009package Ch15_Color_Filters;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.ImageStack;
013import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
014import ij.plugin.filter.GaussianBlur;
015import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
016import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
017import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
018import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
019import imagingbook.common.color.RgbUtils;
020import imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.HsvColorSpace;
021import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
022import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
023import imagingbook.core.jdoc.JavaDocHelp;
024import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
025
026import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
027
028/**
029 * <p>
030 * This ImageJ plugin applies a Gaussian blur filter to selected components in HSV color space. Special attention must
031 * be paid to the periodicity of the hue (H) component, which is an angular quantity. For this purpose, the H values are
032 * split into cosine and sine parts, which are filtered separately and finally combined again to the filtered hue value.
033 * See Sec. 15.1.3 if [1] for details. The components to be filtered can be selected by the user.
034 * </p>
035 * <p>
036 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
037 * (2022).
038 * </p>
039 *
040 * @author WB
041 * @version 2022/12/10
042 */
043public class Gaussian_Filter_HSV implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
044        // TODO: convert to use imagingbook's GenericFilter methods!
045
046        private static final String[] HsvLabels = {"H", "S", "V"};
047        private static double Sigma = 3.0;
048        private static boolean FilterH = true;
049        private static boolean FilterS = false;
050        private static boolean FilterV = false;
051        private static boolean ShowOriginalHsv = false;
052        private static boolean ShowFilteredHsv = false;
053        private static boolean ShowOriginalCosSin = false;
054        private static boolean ShowFilteredCosSin = false;
055
056        /**
057         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open.
058         */
059        public Gaussian_Filter_HSV() {
060                if (noCurrentImage()) {
061                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.ColorTest3);
062                }
063        }
064
065        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
066                return DOES_RGB + NO_CHANGES;
067        }
068
069        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
070                if (!runDialog())
071                        return;
072
073                ColorProcessor cp = (ColorProcessor) ip;
074                final int w = ip.getWidth();
075                final int h = ip.getHeight();
076                
077                FloatProcessor fH = new FloatProcessor(w, h);
078                FloatProcessor fS = new FloatProcessor(w, h);
079                FloatProcessor fV = new FloatProcessor(w, h);
080                
081                // Create Cos/Sin images from the hue angle:
082                HsvColorSpace cc = HsvColorSpace.getInstance();
083                final int[] RGB = new int[3];
084                FloatProcessor fHcos = new FloatProcessor(w, h);
085                FloatProcessor fHsin = new FloatProcessor(w, h);
086                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
087                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
088                                cp.getPixel(u, v, RGB);
089                                float[] hsv = cc.fromRGB (RgbUtils.normalize(RGB));     // all HSV components are in [0,1]
090                                fH.setf(u, v, hsv[0]);
091                                fS.setf(u, v, hsv[1]);
092                                fV.setf(u, v, hsv[2]);
093                                double theta = 2 * Math.PI * hsv[0];
094                                fHcos.setf(u, v, (float) Math.cos(theta));
095                                fHsin.setf(u, v, (float) Math.sin(theta));
096                        }
097                }
098
099                if (ShowOriginalHsv) {
100                        ImageStack stack = new ImageStack();
101                        stack.addSlice("H", fH.duplicate());
102                        stack.addSlice("S", fS.duplicate());
103                        stack.addSlice("V", fV.duplicate());
104                        new ImagePlus("HSV (original)", stack).show();
105                }
106
107                if (ShowOriginalCosSin) {
108                        ImageStack stack = new ImageStack();
109                        stack.addSlice("cos(H)", fHcos.duplicate());
110                        stack.addSlice("sin(H)", fHsin.duplicate());
111                        new ImagePlus("H cos/sin (original)", stack).show();
112                }
113                
114//              int[] hist = fH.getHistogram();
115//              new HistogramPlot(hist, "Hue histogram").show();
116
117                // Apply the Gaussian filter to cos/sin components:
118                GaussianBlur gb = new GaussianBlur();
119
120                if (FilterH) {
121                        gb.blurFloat(fHcos, Sigma, Sigma, 0.002);
122                        gb.blurFloat(fHsin, Sigma, Sigma, 0.002);
123                }
124
125                if (ShowFilteredCosSin) {
126                        ImageStack stack = new ImageStack();
127                        stack.addSlice("cos(H)", fHcos.duplicate());
128                        stack.addSlice("sin(H)", fHsin.duplicate());
129                        new ImagePlus("H cos/sin (filtered)", stack).show();
130                }
131
132                if (FilterS) {
133                        gb.blurFloat(fS, Sigma, Sigma, 0.002);
134                }
135                if (FilterV) {
136                        gb.blurFloat(fV, Sigma, Sigma, 0.002);
137                }
138                
139                // Calculate the filtered hue from cos/sin:
140                FloatProcessor fHrec = combineCosSin(fHcos, fHsin);
141
142                if (ShowFilteredHsv) {
143                        ImageStack stack = new ImageStack();
144                        stack.addSlice("H", fHrec.duplicate());
145                        stack.addSlice("S", fS.duplicate());
146                        stack.addSlice("V", fV.duplicate());
147                        new ImagePlus("HSV (filtered)", stack).show();
148                }
149
150                // new ImagePlus("H (filtered)", fHrec).show();
151                // Reconstruct and show the corresponding RGB image:
152                ColorProcessor cp2 = makeRgb(fHrec, fS, fV);
153                new ImagePlus("RGB (filtered)", cp2).show();
154                
155                // For testing, also show a direct blur of hue (disregarding periodicity):
156                // FloatProcessor fHblur = (FloatProcessor) fH.duplicate();
157                // gb.blurFloat(fHblur, Sigma, Sigma, 0.002);
158                // new ImagePlus("Hblur", fHblur).show();
159                // // Reconstruct and show the corresponding RGB image:
160                // ColorProcessor cp3 = makeRgb(fHblur, fS, fV);
161                // new ImagePlus("hue blurred direct", cp3).show();
162        }
163        
164        
165        private FloatProcessor combineCosSin(FloatProcessor fHcos, FloatProcessor fHsin) {
166                final int w = fHcos.getWidth();
167                final int h = fHcos.getHeight();
168                FloatProcessor fHrec = new FloatProcessor(w, h);
169                final double twoPi = 2 * Math.PI;
170                
171                // rebuild the RGB image from blurred cos/sin
172                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
173                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
174                                double Hcos = fHcos.getf(u, v);
175                                double Hsin = fHsin.getf(u, v);
176                                double Hpp = Math.atan2(Hsin, Hcos);    // Hpp in [-pi, .. pi]
177                                float H = (float) (Arithmetic.mod(Hpp, twoPi) / twoPi);  // H in [0, 1]
178                                fHrec.setf(u, v, H);
179                        }
180                }
181                return fHrec;
182        }
183        
184        /**
185         * Combine 3 FloatProcessors representing a HSV image to a RGB image.
186         * @param fH hue component (values in [0,1])
187         * @param fS saturation component (values in [0,1])
188         * @param fV value component (values in [0,1])
189         * @return A new ColorProcessor.
190         */
191        private ColorProcessor makeRgb(FloatProcessor fH, FloatProcessor fS, FloatProcessor fV) {
192                final int w = fH.getWidth();
193                final int h = fH.getHeight();
194                ColorProcessor cp = new ColorProcessor(w, h);
195                HsvColorSpace cc = HsvColorSpace.getInstance();
196                
197                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
198                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
199                                float H = fH.getf(u, v);
200                                float S = fS.getf(u, v);
201                                float V = fV.getf(u, v);
202                                int[] RGB2 = RgbUtils.denormalize(cc.toRGB(new float[] {H, S, V}));
203                                cp.putPixel(u, v, RGB2);
204                        }
205                }
206                return cp;
207        }
208
209        private boolean runDialog() {
210                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
211                gd.addHelp(getJavaDocUrl());
212                gd.addNumericField("Gaussian sigma", Sigma, 1);
213                gd.setInsets(0, 0, 0);
214                gd.addMessage("Components to filter:");
215                gd.setInsets(0, 10, 0);
216                gd.addCheckboxGroup(1, 3, HsvLabels, new boolean[] {FilterH, FilterS, FilterV});
217                gd.addCheckbox("Show original HSV components", ShowOriginalHsv);
218                gd.addCheckbox("Show filtered HSV components", ShowFilteredHsv);
219                gd.addCheckbox("Show original H cos/sin", ShowOriginalCosSin);
220                gd.addCheckbox("Show filtered H cos/sin", ShowFilteredCosSin);
221
222                gd.showDialog();
223                if(gd.wasCanceled())
224                        return false;
225
226                Sigma = gd.getNextNumber();
227                FilterH = gd.getNextBoolean();
228                FilterS = gd.getNextBoolean();
229                FilterV = gd.getNextBoolean();
230                ShowOriginalHsv = gd.getNextBoolean();
231                ShowFilteredHsv = gd.getNextBoolean();
232                ShowOriginalCosSin = gd.getNextBoolean();
233                ShowFilteredCosSin = gd.getNextBoolean();
234                return true;
235        }
236}
